step1.sentence: The manager will assess performance at the end of each quarter to determine who qualifies for a promotion.

step2.story: After six months at the new company, Jina's team leader sat her down for a one-on-one meeting. He explained that the company would assess performance based on both individual results and teamwork. Jina felt nervous but prepared — she had kept detailed records of every project she contributed to.

step3.story: Every December, the consulting firm held its annual review week. Partners would assess performance across all departments, examining everything from client satisfaction scores to internal collaboration. This year, David knew the stakes were higher than ever — three senior positions had opened up, and dozens of analysts were competing for them. He stayed late every night polishing his portfolio and gathering feedback from colleagues. When the results finally came out, David's name was at the top of the list. The months of quiet, consistent effort had spoken louder than any last-minute scramble could.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 직역하면 '성과를 평가하다'로, 업무 수행 결과를 체계적으로 판단한다는 뜻입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 직장에서 정기적인 인사 평가, 프로젝트 결과 검토, 팀원의 업무 역량을 공식적으로 측정할 때 사용합니다. 단순히 '잘했다/못했다'가 아니라 기준에 따라 분석적으로 판단하는 뉘앙스입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: assess는 라틴어 'assidere(옆에 앉다)'에서 유래했으며, 원래 세금을 매기기 위해 옆에 앉아 가치를 판단하던 행위를 뜻했습니다. performance는 '수행, 실행'을 의미하는 영어 단어로, 두 단어가 결합해 '업무 수행을 체계적으로 판단하다'라는 비즈니스 표현이 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: evaluate보다 좀 더 공식적이고 체계적인 느낌을 줍니다. 일상 대화보다는 HR, 경영, 컨설팅 등 비즈니스 맥락에서 주로 쓰이는 격식 있는 표현입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We need to assess performance before deciding on year-end bonuses.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 연말 보너스를 결정하기 전에 성과를 평가해야 합니다.
